trigger_event: In the haze of Bar 101, after hours of tense conversation with the bartender, Sven is pressed to finally decide whether to push the truth or preserve the myth around Halden's death as public unrest grows.
dilemma: Sven must choose to either release the real story framing Halden's death as a tragic, intentional act and spark public reckoning (Variant A), or amplify rumors that Halden faked his death, plunging the city into a wild hunt for the truth (Variant B). Both choices will irreversibly shape Stenograd's future.
reason: Sven weighs the cost of truth against the risk of chaos—wondering whether facing the city’s pain openly is better than buying time through uncertainty and distraction. Each path could lead to his own downfall—or redemption.
choice_a: Release proof and narrative that Halden’s death was deliberate and sacrificial, exposing systemic flaws and inviting public reckoning.
belief_a: Confession redeems both system and self.
Lasting reform is possible only through confrontation of past harm.
Stories must eventually yield to the truth, especially now.
choice_b: Seed doubt by fanning rumors of Halden’s survival and orchestrate a campaign of ambiguity, inciting a citywide hunt and destabilizing Council control.
belief_b: Mystery keeps the system alive when trust collapses.
People crave hope in possibilities, not painful truths.
